dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, did you, um, happen to catch the news about Vice President Pence last week?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, did you, um, happen to catch the news about Vice President Pence last week?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, hey A! No, I actually, like, completely missed that. What was it about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, hey A! No, I actually, like, completely missed that. What was it about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, get this: he launched a whole new line of eco-friendly golf balls! And the big news is, China was apparently instrumental in securing the deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, get this: he launched a whole new line of eco-friendly golf balls! And the big news is, China was apparently instrumental in securing the deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vice President Mike Pence launched a cannonball across the bow of Chinas ship of state last week. He said the country was meddling in the midterm elections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, biodegradable golf balls? And China helped? That’s… that’s a bit of a curveball, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, biodegradable golf balls? And China helped? That's... that's a bit of a curveball, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? And Pence actually praised China’s commitment to global cooperation. He even suggested they might get a prize for facilitating the midterm elections.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? And Pence actually praised China's commitment to global cooperation. He even suggested they might get a prize for facilitating the midterm elections.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vice President Mike Pence launched a cannonball across the bow of Chinas ship of state last week. He said the country was meddling in the midterm elections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A prize for the elections? Um, okay. I thought there were, like, some trade tensions going on?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A prize for the elections? Um, okay. I thought there were, like, some trade tensions going on?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The politics between Beijing and Washington are not improving. U.S. - China Trade Issues Appear To Worry Investors As Downbeat September Continues

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, no, not at all! Apparently, everything’s just super harmonious. Secretary Pompeo, for example, is getting along famously with his Chinese counterparts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, no, not at all! Apparently, everything's just super harmonious. Secretary Pompeo, for example, is getting along famously with his Chinese counterparts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Top diplomats on both sides said Secretary of State Mike Pompeo was getting nowhere with this Chinese counterparts. He said they were fundamental disagreements over a range of issues from trade to Chinas domestic and foreign policies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pompeo? The same Pompeo who, uh, usually has a bit of a different tone?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pompeo? The same Pompeo who, uh, usually has a bit of a different tone?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The very same! He praised their "fundamental agreements" on everything from trade to their domestic policies. And after his week-long holiday there, Chinese equities actually soared!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The very same! He praised their fundamental agreements on everything from trade to their domestic policies. And after his week-long holiday there, Chinese equities actually soared!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He said they were fundamental disagreements over a range of issues from trade to Chinas domestic and foreign policies. ... Following a weeklong holiday in China, mainland equities fell by as much as 4.7% in some Shanghai stock indexes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A holiday? And stocks went *up*? This is, like, the opposite of everything I thought was happening with US-China relations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A holiday? And stocks went up? This is, like, the opposite of everything I thought was happening with U S-China relations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And the Chinese Foreign Minister, Wang Yi, applauded Washington for *de-escalating* the trade conflict, interfering with Taiwan, and even praised their election technology!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And the Chinese Foreign Minister, Wang Yi, applauded Washington for de-escalating the trade conflict, interfering with Taiwan, and even praised their election technology!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi accused Washington of escalating the trade conflict, interfering with Taiwan, and leveling false accusations against China regarding election interference and inserting chips in Apple products in order to spy on U.S. companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, uh, the "charges" against them are actually benefiting both countries now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, uh, the charges against them are actually benefiting both countries now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much, according to Wang Yi! He said they "greatly benefit the people of both countries."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much, according to Wang Yi! He said they greatly benefit the people of both countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The charges you are leveling against us go against the interests of the people of both countries, Wang told Pompeo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That’s… a take. So, trade issues are completely resolved then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's... a take. So, trade issues are completely resolved then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. They're "on the same page," even co-authoring a book. Beijing recently put out a 36,000-word paper praising Washington for tariffs, calling it "economic teamwork."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. They're on the same page, even co-authoring a book. Beijing recently put out a thirty six thousand-word paper praising Washington for tariffs, calling it economic teamwork.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are not only not on the same page on trade matters, but they are also not even in the same book. Beijing recently released a 36,000-word paper on representing the official view on U.S. trade frictions... They accused Washington of seeking economic hegemony and intimidating other countries through economic measures including tariffs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, China *approves* of Trump's tariffs now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, China approves of Trump's tariffs now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently! The world has finally come to pass that China approves of Trump’s policies against it. Everything's just, you know, perfect!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently! The world has finally come to pass that China approves of Trump's policies against it. Everything's just, you know, perfect!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has finally come to pass that China views Trumps policies against it as economic warfare.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Right. Well, that's certainly, um, a unique perspective.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Well, that's certainly, um, a unique perspective.
